data.title: OPCODE lib - rewrite swap, add xorswap
Remove vertex paint from sketch tool shapes
data.body:
When you create shapes with the sketch tool and have a material that has vertex paint enabled the sketch tool shapes are all colorful and it seems they got a different random color on each side.
The vertex paint color is always there but you only see it if you have a material on it that has vertex paint enabled.
I use vertex paint for a lot of materials, so it is quite a problem for me using these materials with the sketch tool, so I would like to get rid of the vertex paint.

data.title: SQLite Integration
data.body:
I have used the updated version of Chris Calef work to add this.

I have added the cmake file so that you can choose to have it or not

data.title: #define AUTOPAINT_UNDO
data.body:
This edit makes it easy to enable/disable the terrain autopaint undo.

When using large terrains 1024+ the undo code takes an absolute age to complete, while the undo functionality can be disabled, it is spread throughout the code.

data.title: TORQUE_BUILD_TYPE in cmake
data.body:
The TORQUE_BUILD_TYPE is set to "Debug" by default, people building using the command line do not know that.
So would it make sense to set that to "Release" by default?
I don't really know which setting is needed more often, but I think most people want a release build, since they do not do engine development, just an idea.

data.title: Adds missing GFX Texture format strings
data.body:
This commit eliminates 5 warnings output from VALIDATE_LOOKUPTABLE here: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gfx/gfxStringEnumTranslate.cpp#L167
And prevents a fatal error here: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gfx/gfxTextureManager.cpp#L1371
that occurs when called from GuiOffscreenCanvas::_setupTargets() for an OpenVROverlay because GFXFormatR8G8B8A8_LINEAR_FORCE  is used.

data.title: Reworks the $Core::commonShaderPath variable usage
data.body: Reworks the $Core::commonShaderPath variable usage to be a static variable in ShaderGen for efficiency(only one getVariable when shadergen is initialized), as well as implements the ability to set a default value, and ensures that it tries to set a path even if the pref variable is missing which is important for ported projects from older builds.

data.title: Fix for terrain detail color blending post-linearization
data.body:
This PR seeks to adress #2050 .

In the image below, you can see the difference in results, before this PR is to the right, and after is to the left.
![](http://i.imgur.com/7L8s0iH.png)

data.title: Terrain texture colors are off since 3.8
data.body:
As detailed by @Bloodknight [here](http://forums.torque3d.org/viewtopic.php?f=2&p=8394#p8388), the terrain textures seem slightly off in color. It's more pronounced the more detailed the textures become.
The major issue with this, is that it complicates the use of detail-textures as the close-up color contributor for terrains.

3.8:
![](http://i.imgur.com/qSyXlRX.jpg)


3.9/3.10:
![](http://imgur.com/JyjR7GF.jpg)

data.title: Fixes blending issues while respecting #1704
data.body:
The corrections to the blendTotal were reverted due to issue #1704 . This will revert that revert, while also making the terrain render in a single pass (at least for up to ~20 textures layers per terrain cell, which should be reasonable).

In order to allow rendering the terrain in a single pass, I had to move some calculations from vertex to pixel shader, so a benchmark on how this affects performance should definetly be considered.

In theory, it should be possible to solve this issue with the multi-pass rendering technique utilized currently, but I haven't been able to make it work.

Edit: Furthermore, due to an issue where you can't get the constNum of a texture, the code is a bit ugly and difficult to maintain, as it assumes a specific ordering in the shader's texture constants. Should only be an issue when someone messes with that part of the terrain shader though.

Edit2: Clarified it is 20 texture layers and not 20 textures.

data.title: extra option for terrain block to disable the update of the basetextu…
data.body:
…re 2

Little change that was missing in the first PR since Github web interface does not seem allow editing multiple files for a PR and I was lazy.

data.title: extra option for terrain block to disable the update of the basetexture
data.body: This adds another checkbox in the terrain datablock in the editor, where you can disable the auto generation of the basetexture, which allows you to use a custom basetexture for the whole terrain. Terrain generation software often puts out a precalculated basetexture and with this option you can use it by just renaming it into level.basetex.png or whatever and the engine will use it and not overwrite it.

Object mesh "shape200" has no matching detail ("detail200" has been added automatically)
Object mesh "shape100" has no matching detail ("detail100" has been added automatically)
Object mesh "col-1" has no matching detail ("Collision-1" has been added automatically)

data.title: MissionMarker has redundant mAddedToScene variable
data.body:
MissionMarker has a variable, `mAddedToScene` ( https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/c83efa59e0a11fc15c68afaf106807643191ac6f/Engine/source/T3D/missionMarker.cpp#L87 ), which unnecessarily duplicates functionality already available in SceneObject which will tell you if a SceneObject has already been added to the scene (e.g. by testing `getSceneManager() != NULL`).

Unfortunately this also presents a bug. If you call `setHidden` on a MissionMarker or CameraBookmark to make the MissionMarker visible without entering the editor, you will trigger the Assert in the SceneObject destructor code when the object is deleted ( https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/c83efa59e0a11fc15c68afaf106807643191ac6f/Engine/source/scene/sceneObject.cpp#L154 ).
